div.div:
alan s - June 2, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.2.2
Beautiful but...
...why does it impose a random keyboard of it's own? The first rule of simplicity is surely not to reinvent the wheel. I use Swype for everything, why should I need to tap letters for this one app? There should at very least be an option to use the normal system keyboard

Obi - May 13, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.2.2
Beautifully simple
I've used many task management apps, but I always go back to the basics, and this does that perfectly. Intuitive UI just doesn't get in the way ever. Maybe some cloud/task syncing option would improve further though?

Hatem - May 31, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.2.2
Keyboard
Would be perfect if it used the native keyboard instead of its own custom keyboard. A bit annoying if you're used to SwiftKey predictions, Swype or something like that!

Tracy - May 14, 2012 - Motorola Atrix with version 1.2.2
Love it
Love the app and the ui but with this new update it seems to be a bit slower Update: The speed is back, yay! Update: Would love to see a widget!

Abhi - May 18, 2012 - Version 1.2.2
Nice interface but the keyboard is buggy.
Lots of error with the built in keyboard. I wish that it would use the system keyboard. Also, it ate one of my list, meaning - I had a list with 17 items! I go back the next day and only 5 of it were left. I am so annoyed! I can't remember all the items on it!

Sagar - May 18, 2012 - HTC Incredible 2 with version 1.2.2
Mind=blown (reddit)
I wish this app would take off...and please add a feature to sync with my Google account.

Ed - June 9, 2012 - HTC Evo 4G with version 1.2.2
All form, little function.
Simple. Clean. Beautiful. Those are its only redeeming qualities. Keeps losing list entries upon normal exit or [Home] exit. No auto capitalization. Intermittent random blocks appear in lieu of letters. No moveable cursor. Odd number anomaly appears (bottom of list) when list item contains a number (ie., $100) - probably linked to calculator function (silly). Needs integration with spellcheck. In short, "All form, no function."

Jean-Philippe - May 31, 2012 - Version 1.2.2
Simply perfect
This app is so simple and intuitive, while giving me every features I need. I <3 it, thank you !

Mohamed - May 25, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.2.2
Simple and fun to use
Wonderful UI and very simple and easy to use. Does the job of creating lists, to-do etc..

Kris - June 12, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF201 with version 1.2.2
Potential to be
After actually using - please fix the portrait only options and the custom keyboard.

Duplex - May 29, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.2.2
This list is AWESOME!
I love this app! From the ease of use right down to the coolest sounds and animations...the BEST list Ive used!

Sujati - May 16, 2012 - Samsung Nexus S with version 1.2.2
Need new icon design
Please redesign the icon, it look so ugly, i think the first icon design is good, no need to change that

Ernesto - June 16, 2012 - HTC One S with version 1.2.2
Good, not perfect.
Good but very buggy, have to reset the app multiple tines as it keeps freezing. Sometimes have to reset my phone too. Can't be my phone as its the only app that this happens for. HTC One S.

Birdy - May 13, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.2.2
Small app
Small app but so useful

elias - June 12, 2012 - Version 1.2.2
Great app!

Ashanth - May 11, 2012 - HTC One X with version 1.2.1
Widget please!
Great interface based on clear for ios, but should add the option of stock keyboard. Also please add a homescreen widget! Until then I will continue to use any.do

Joe - May 17, 2012 - HTC Sensation 4G with version 1.2.1
Great app overall
Pros: Great functionality and great design. Google should hire this guy. Would love to see an HD tablet version of this. Cons: Landscape mode would be nice as well.

uudashr - May 13, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.2.1
Awsome UI
Greate the only weakness is only the keyboard.. Oftenly miss type..

Shawnshine - May 11, 2012 - Motorola Defy with version 1.2.1
Gorgeous UI
Amazing!

Matt - May 9, 2012 - Version 1.2
great ui, but...
Really like the UI for this app, but there are 2 things that really need to be addressed: 1) no landscape mode 2) hardware keyboard is not recognized at all. please fix those two items and this app will be 5 stars!

KingHallett - May 10, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.2
Really nice
However could you please stop asking me if I want to quit, it is a bit obtrusive. Also an option to use the default keyboard will be nice. Being able to turn the graphics down would also help improve the performance as it is quite slow on even my high performance device.

Ali - May 9, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 1.2
Amazing start
This app is incredible and is the first I've used that makes it a pleasure to do to-do lists. It needs a few mods urgently though and it will be almost perfect: Sync with Google Tasks; Use native keyboard or use auto correct from system; Backup and restore feature.... Thanks dev for such a genuinely quality app with attention to detail that makes the whole thing shine. Prefer the old icon though - sorry! Please bring it back.... ?

LockedNLoaded - May 10, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF201 with version 1.2
Very nice GUI easy to figure out BUT
8mb (and growing) is not "minimalistic" but is huge for this app it seems. Love the app dev is responsive & open to feedback. Is adding a gaming number system really needed or a step towards bloatware? KISS

May 10, 2012 - Motorola Droid X with version 1.2
holy crap this is a good
this is how you develop an application interface. if this app was a game, I would give it a 10 out of 10 for gameplay and controls. Finally, a list making app that I actually use on a daily basis!

Armondo - May 10, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.2
Great job
Fast response on issues on key board. Simple and great looking UI. Recommend you give it a try.

krish - May 11, 2012 - Version 1.2
Yes
Yes, the best in terms of UI, but need to add backup, sync options.. Problem : When the text exceed some length, its not shown properly..

Sam - April 30, 2012 - Version 1.1.4
Beautiful and buttery-smooth
The UI design is phenomenal. Everything feels very visceral and natural. Some functionality is lacking that you may miss from other note/lists apps, like syncing, but the developer is hard at work to incorporate all those things you might want.

Glenn - May 4, 2012 - HTC G2 with version 1.1.4
Great app, fantastic support.
Absolutely love the ux. I had some issues initially, but contacted the developer and was treated with a very fast reply. Excellent all-around!

August - May 8, 2012 - HTC EVO 3D with version 1.1.4
Slick, easy to use but...
Really like this program, especially at the price. I like the way it works. The design is easy on the eyes. Could be.better. Does not rotate screen when rotating phone. Also, no voice recognition. This would make entering things less tedious.

Evan - May 3, 2012 - Version 1.1.4
Pretty and efficient
Despite being a minimalistic app, it is very intuitive and easy to pick up. Looks to have derived strong inspiration from Clear of Apple's ecosystem. Keyboard could be better. Would love the ability to sync. Amongst the better looking and user-friendly UI in the android marketplace.

Mohammed - May 8, 2012 - Version 1.1.4
Beautiful interface
I have started using any excuse possible to use this app as it is a joy for the eyes and runs very smoothly.

didgerman - May 5, 2012 - Version 1.1.4
Nice, but export is odd
Works well enough. I have problems on HTC One X, but I think that's Sense's fault, a fix would be good though. Also the export by mail just exports the whole list, regardless of what was checked, which seems to be pointless. Holding out for fixes... Here's an update on the export: Exporting to gmail and reading on a phone seems to export the whole list without selections. But exporting to evernote and reading on a PC *does* retain the selections. Which makes this a good app for attendance taking.....

Nat - May 6, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.1.4
Breathtaking
Beautifully designed and makes task management a fun and rewarding experience

PK - April 29, 2012 - Samsung Nexus S with version 1.1.4
Beautiful
What a fantastic app. Gorgeous UI and smooth animation. Love it. Definitely keeping an eye on this dev for more apps

Mike - May 8, 2012 - Samsung Droid Charge with version 1.1.4
Very cool!
Finally, to do lists are fun!

Luke - April 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.1.4
Absolutely beautiful
I don't think I'm being overly hyperbolic when I say this is, without question, the best app I have ever used in 3 years of using Android. It looks beautiful, the animations are smooth as anything and it runs fantastically. Great work, and many thanks to the dev. Look forward to seeing what else you bring out! A set of apps with this GUI scheme would be incredible.

Davey - May 6, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.1.4
Fantastic
Love it, so simple to use

Linn - May 6, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.1.4
samsung galaxy s2
doesnt save changes or additions made to lists when i leave the app over half of the times attempted. makes it useless. but very pretty and functional apart from this.

Fanis - April 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.1.4
Beautifully designed, very usable
Saw this on reddit and decided to buy it based on the comments. Definitely worth the money, and the author looks on top of suggestions and bugs, like the ability to use android native keyboards.

Lynn Root - May 9, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.1.4
So beautiful!
This app is so fun to use! Makes me actually want to keep better track of tasks. perhaps there will be Swype ability in the future?

Cong - May 7, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.1.4
Smooth and Intuitive
Love the design like everyone else, just waiting on a few more features like sync and widgets. Very minimalist right now, which isn't all bad.

Michael - May 2, 2012 - LG Optimus 2X with version 1.1.4
Great interface
I'm highly impressed with the ease and convenience of this app. So simple yet so useful.

Alex - May 8, 2012 - Version 1.1.4
Excellent!
I wish all android apps werr this polished! Thank you for soing it right! Can you make it sync with Google tasks or Wunderlist? Also need 'set due date'

Andrew - April 30, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 1.1.4
Wow!
Verrry impressed!

ekelrock thick5 - May 1, 2012 - Motorola Droid X with version 1.1.4
Great interface
...but I'd love the ability to use my own keyboard (for swype purposes) and the ability to move the cursor when making list items. Overall a great list app!

celyn - May 7, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.1.4
Great
All we need is a widget.

TORR - April 30, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.1.4
Nice
I'd only ask for google tasks sync :p

Doug - April 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.1.4
Really Well Made
Animations are smooth, and really easy interaction. Looking forward to a few updates and it will be perfect.

nascent - April 30, 2012 - HTC G2 with version 1.1.4
Would love sync
Gorgeous ui. Sync would make it. Also looking forward to Swype support.

Shantum - April 30, 2012 - HTC Desire HD with version 1.1.4
Everything that a list app should be
I wonder why all the others cant seem to hit the spot so well! It PERFECT!

Matt - April 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.1.4
Unbelievable!
Incredible UI. Gorgeous.

Parker - April 30, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.1.4
Awesome
Love it. Hopefully this developer cranks out some more apps. Fluid, beautiful, well done

Charley - April 29, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S with version 1.1.4
This is truly superb
Beauitful, great UI, responsive and easily worth the money!

srheug - May 10, 2012 - EeePad Transformer TF101 with version 1.1.4
Simple, Fast, Easy
This app works! Not a lot of fancy bells and whistles. Just does what it should. MAKES LISTS. A real innovative UI. Kinda fun

Moshe - May 2, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.1.4
Awesome

Joe - April 26, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Note with version 1.1.3
Excellent, but could use a widget
Truly beautiful app, but I'd love to see a widget to keep important lists at the front of my mind on my home screen

Drumster - April 25, 2012 - Motorola Droid II with version 1.1.3
Awesome!
Really awesome app. Just one suggestion. I should be able to use my own keyboard.

Daniel - April 21, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S2 with version 1.1.2
cool
really cool interface. very proffesional looking. i like it :)

EduardoRT - April 22, 2012 - Version 1.1.2
Vale la pena
Excelente programa visualmente muy agradable, super rápido y con muchos gestos fáciles de recordar y muy útiles.

TJ - April 29, 2012 - HTC Droid Incredible
Works exactly as advertised
The video shows you exactly what you're going to get in full, so watch it and choose for your self. Personally, I really like it's interface and think it looks and works really well. As it is now, you can't use your personal keyboard and are stuck with a not-so-fancy built in one. The dev says that it is a bug with the SDK and is pushing to get it fixed, so full keyboard support should be coming sometime soon.

Edward - May 3, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus
Best to do app I've used
Really simply and easy to use and haven't experienced any bugs or issues. I'd like to see a reminder function for time sensitive tasks, and a widget to use on a home screen would be perfect for this app. As of right now the app is well worth the price regardless!

div.p: The interface and control methods are fantastic. Needs to be updated to allow other installed keyboards instead of it's default one. It makes me miss my swype keyboard.

div.h4: The in-built keyboard makes it a non-stater

div.p: The in-built keyboard makes it a non-stater for me. Dev has suggested he will be including the native keyboard sometime however.. The rest is very impressive and well-thought out though!

div.div:
Will - April 30, 2012 - Motorola Droid X
Great Application
This is great as it is. If there is one feature I would request, it would be Google Tasks integration.

Marios - May 12, 2012 - HTC Nexus One with version 1.2.2
nice but hate the keyboard
very nice interface but you should be able to use system keyboard!!

Michael - May 1, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy S
Amazing
Best to-do software I've ever seen, perfectly minimal and beautiful.

Mike-Bri - May 2, 2012 - Motorola Droid II
Beautiful
Smooth
